thread.title: Sydney flooding: Maserati drivers trapped, building unstable, murder trials suspended - Yahoo7
thread.title_full: Sydney flooding: Maserati drivers trapped, building unstable, murder trials suspended - Yahoo7

author: Agencies On February
title: Sydney flooding: Maserati drivers trapped, building unstable, murder trials suspended - Yahoo7
text:
Share Sydney flooding: Maserati drivers trapped, building unstable, murder trials suspended - Yahoo7 Severe weather has wreaked havoc across Sydney, leaving the driver of a Maserati trapped and causing fears a building may be in danger of collapsing. Close Rain dumped on Sydney with flash flooding likely to follow UP NEXT VIDEO Rain dumped on Sydney with flash flooding likely to follow. 7News Rain dumped on Sydney with flash flooding likely to follow 
The luxury car was filmed stuck in the floodwaters in Redfern in the inner-city just after 11am this morning. 
A further 13 cars were also left stranded when parts of the CBD received 50mm of rain within 30 minutes on Tuesday morning. 
A New South Wales SES spokeswoman said ambitious drivers were risking their own lives and the lives of the volunteers that had to come and save them. 
"The water is very rapid and rising quite quickly ... if you know there is going to be a flood, pre-plan your journey rather than risking people's lives," she told 7 News Online. Volunteers are on site at Ewart Street Marrickville for building threat and are working with other agencies to determine course of action. — NSW SES (@NSWSES) February 7, 2017 
SES crews are on scene at an apartment complex on Ewart Street Marrickville, assessing the structural integrity of the building, worried there may be a possibility of it collapsing. 
It is understood there is a water hole behind the building causing instability. Maserati stuck on Redfern Street in Redfern #sydneyweather pic.twitter.com/9CjD9U8IM6 — Fleur Mitchell (@flossisboss) February 7, 2017 Sydney CBD workers are caught in a torrential downpour as heavy rain falls across Sydney. Source: AAP A pedestrian attempts to shield themselves from the torrential rains. Source: AAP Not all Sydneysiders are hating the flashflooding. Source:Renny Hancock Osorasize=O 
At least two murder trials were suspended at the NSW Supreme Court when the King Street building was evacuated, as water streamed down internal stairs. 
The wild weather has left a large portion of Redfern without power, with as many as 700 people affected, while homes and businesses in Surry Hills are thought to have also lost power. 
The flash flooding has also left another driver trapped on the corner of Parramatta Road and Flood Street, Leichhardt. 
Sydney Airport travellers are being advised to check with their airlines about any disruptions, while light rail services have been cancelled between Dulwich Hill and Central due to flooding. Time lapse of the storm hitting Sydney this morning. https://t.co/Aq67txfRua #SydneyStorm #7News pic.twitter.com/jkfehDELCh — 7 News Sydney (@7NewsSydney) February 7, 2017 Leichhardt: Flooding affecting traffic. Person trapped in a car at the corner of Parramatta Road & Flood Street. #SydneyStorm #7News pic.twitter.com/XCDL1IaFrI — 7 News Sydney (@7NewsSydney) February 7, 2017 Sydney finally got some rain pic.twitter.com/Q15hrZDJkL — Catherine Cranston (@CatCranston) February 7, 2017 Traffic chaos across Sydney 
In the west, Penrith, Parramatta and Campbelltown also experienced the full force of the storm, as did Wollongong and Port Kembla south of Sydney. 
Motorists travelling across the Anzac Bridge were also experiencing major delays due to soaked roads.
